div.head: William Allen Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen I William Allen of Charles County in the
province of maryland and being weak in body but of perfect minde memory.
prasied be God for the same doe make & ordaine this my last will &
testament I hereby working all farmer wills whatsoever This day of
January in the year of our Lord one thousand six hundred sixty nine
and first of all I bequeath my soule into the hands of almighty God who
gave it and my body unto the ground from where it came and for–
what small estate it haith please God to lend me I desire it may be–
bestowed in manner following–

I give and bequeath all my Estate hereafter unto my Daughter
Elizabeth Allen.

Item. I will and bequeath that my wife Martha Allen may enjoy my said Estate
untill my said Daughter comes to age and if it please God to take her before
she comes to age I give and bequeath it unto my wife Martha Allen and her heirs
Item I give and bequeath unto my goddaughter Mary Harrison Daughter of
Joseph Harrison one brown cow commonly called by the name Mealey
now about the plantation of John Wheeler together with all her
future increase the said cow is on the right ear &
to her the said [many the heirs?] forever

Item I give and bequeath unto Luke Greene of Charles County one red heifer age
about two years of the same age being marked with the abovesaid
ear mark now at or about the plantation of John Ash
to him the said Luke Greene & his heirs forever.

Item I give and bequeath unto John Mun son of John Mun one brown cow called
by the name of Double of the ear mark to him the said John
Mun this & his heirs forever.
Item I give and bequeath my Gun & Bible unto Roger Veritas

Item I make & ordaine my brother in Law John Mun Executor of thus my Last
and
and Testament him to be careful to see it performed In Testimony
hereof I have hereunto set my hand & seal the day & year above is written

Signed sealed and Delivered
In presents of us…
Matthew Moopher
Mark of
Charles Mooley
William Allen

On the back of the foregoing will was this Endorsed to will
July 13th Know all new by these presents that I John Mun of Charles
County doe freely & of my all the Interest and
last unto me by brother in law Will Allen of this his last
will and Testament unto Gerrard Bronner as my hand and
Seal

Signed sealed and Delivered
In the presents of us-
Mary M A Allen
mark
Peter B

By virtue of a Comm. from the hand of Mr. William Talbot Baronet Chief
Judge in Testimony causes within This province of Maryland leaving
take the eleventh day of August in the year of the Dominion of
&c. Army from 1621 to me and me
to call before me John Mun the Executor of the last will and testament
of William Allen late of Charles County deceased and take his acknowledgement
of his of the trust of an Executor in him by the said
deceased to call the and cause the same
by their paths to be from these are humbly to certify that on the thirteenth
day of September in the year above. Came before me John Mum.
Executor above and did acknowledge the of the
Trust
Trust of an Exectutor in him by Mr. Allen deceased as above written–
Likewise then came Charles Molly one of the nitne to the within written will–
and made oath that he saw the within writing signed sealed and–
published by the within named William Allen as his last will and
Testament, and further that the unclear Mr. William Allen was in sound senee and
memory when he the same
End
6 sides
Benj. Rozer
